tit.e: Chosan (resistance of farmers against their feudal lord)
tit.cmt: "(resistance of farmers against their feudal lord)" not necessary in title

sen.j: 逃散（ちょうさん）とは、日本の中世から近世にかけて行われた農民抵抗の手段、闘争形態である。
sen.e: Chosan was a means of the resistance and a way of strife of farmers in medieval Japan.
Chosan was means of resistance and a form of struggle waged by farmers in Japan from the middle ages to the early modern period.
Chosan was means of resistance and forms of struggle waged by farmers in Japan from the middle ages to the early modern period.

sen.j: 古代の律令時代に本貫から逃れて流浪する逃亡とは区別される。
sen.e: It is differentiated from the flight that is escaping from a birthplace and wandering in ancient Ritsuryo period.
It is different from the tobo phenomenon of fleeing one's birthplace during the ancient Ritsuryo period.
It is different from the tobo phenomenon of fleeing one's birthplace during the ancient Ritsuryo period.

sen.j: 江戸時代以前
sen.e: Before the Edo period
Before the Edo Period
Before the Edo Period

sen.j: 村の住民（百姓など）が集団で荘園から退去して一時的に他の土地へ逃げ込み、領主に対して年貢軽減や代官の罷免などを求める。
sen.e: A group of residents, such as peasants, left their manor and run into other lands temporarily to demand a feudal lord for land tax reduction and dismissal of a local governor, etc.

Village residents (such as peasants) would leave manors en masse and temporarily take refuge in other areas where they would make demand that the feudal lord take actions such as the reduction of land taxes and the dismissal of the local governor.

Village residents (such as peasants) would leave manors en masse and temporarily take refuge in other areas where they would make demand that the feudal lord take actions such as the reduction of land taxes and the dismissal of the local governor.

sen.j: 要求が受け入れられた場合には帰住した。
sen.e: They returned their place when a demand was granted.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: They would return once their demands had been met.
They would return once their demands had been met.

sen.j: 百姓申状の提出や起請文の作成など所定の手続きを経ていれば合法的な抵抗手段として認められていた。
sen.e: It was admitted as a lawful resistance means through required procedure, such as submission of a peasant moshijo (a document format for communicating something from a lower person to an upper person) and documentation of kishomon (sworn oath).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The process was recognized as a lawful means of resistance in the event that a hyakusho moshijo (a written report submitted from a low-ranking person to a higher ranking person) was submitted, a written vow was made and fixed procedures were adhered to.

The process was recognized as a lawful means of resistance in the event that a hyakusho moshijo (a written report submitted from a low-ranking person to a higher ranking person) was submitted, kishomon (sworn oath) was made and fixed procedures were adhered to.

sen.j: 南北朝時代（日本）から増加した。
sen.e: It had increased from the Period of the Northern and Southern Courts (Japan).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The phenomenon increased from the period of the Northern and Southern Courts (Japan).
The phenomenon increased from the period of the Northern and Southern Courts (Japan).

sen.j: 戦国時代（日本）には、戦乱に伴って山賊や海賊などの被害が多く、また重い年貢を課されたため逃げ出すものが多かった。
sen.e: During the Warring States period (Japan), many people had escaped because they often suffered from hill bandits and pirates, etc., and because they were imposed heavy land tax.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: During the Warring States period (Japan), conflict meant that there were many people who fled due to suffering at the hands of bandits as well as many who fled in order to avoid heavy land taxes.

During the Sengoku Period (Warring States period) (Japan), conflict meant that there were many people who fled due to suffering at the hands of bandits or pirates as well as many who fled in order to avoid heavy land taxes.
sen.cmt: 統一リストに合わせました。

sen.j: 戦国大名たちはこのような人間が出ないように工夫することも大名としての能力であるといえる。
sen.e: It was up to how capable the Sengoku Period daimyo was to prevent their escapes.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: It can be said that the capability of Sengoku period daimyo (feudal lords) was measured by their ability to prevent such people from fleeing.
It can be said that the capability of Sengoku daimyo (Japanese territorial lord in the Sengoku period) was measured by their ability to prevent such people from fleeing.
sen.cmt: 統一リストに合わせました。

sen.j: 1488年に加賀において守護の富樫政親を追放し、門徒領国を形成した。
sen.e: In 1488, people of Kaga expelled the shugo (provincial constable) Masachika TOGASHI and formed the monto-ryogoku (territory of followers).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: In 1488, the people of Kaga expelled the shugo (provincial constable), Masachika TOGASHI, and formed the monto-ryogoku (territory of followers).
In 1488, the people of Kaga expelled the shugo (provincial constable), Masachika TOGASHI, and formed the monto-ryogoku (territory of followers).

sen.j: この加賀一向一揆は、領主と戦った例として知られる。
sen.e: It is called Kaga Ikko ikki Revolt and known as an example of revolt against the feudal lord.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: This Kaga Ikko-ikki Revolt is known as an example of revolt against a feudal lord.
This Kaga Ikko-ikki Revolt is known as an example of revolt against a feudal lord.

sen.j: 江戸時代
sen.e: Edo period
Edo Period
Edo Period

sen.j: 江戸時代には、逃散した百姓が都市部へ出て、安い賃金で生活することが一般に見られた。
sen.e: In the Edo period, many chosan peasants went to urban areas and lived on low wages.
During the Edo period, many chosan peasants generally left for urban areas where they lived on low wages.
During the Edo period, many chosan peasants generally left for urban areas where they lived on low wages.

sen.j: 生産者である百姓の逃散は、生産活動の減退を意味する。
sen.e: Since peasants were farm producers, their chosan might cause the decline of production activities.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Since peasants were farm producers, their chosan led to a decrease in production activities.
Since peasants were farm producers, their chosan led to a decrease in production activities.

sen.j: そのため、支配者（幕府、大名、旗本ら）は百姓の逃散を厳しく禁ずるとともに、移住も原則として認めなかった。
sen.e: Therefore, the rulers (feudal government, feudal lords and direct vassals of a shogun) severely forbade chosan of peasants and did not admit migration as a rule either.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Therefore, the rulers (bakufu (feudal government headed by a shogun), feudal lords and direct vassals of the shogun) strictly forbade the chosan and generally did not recognize migration.
Therefore, the rulers (bakufu [feudal government headed by a shogun], feudal lords and direct vassals of the shogun) strictly forbade the chosan and generally did not recognize migration.

sen.j: 一揆の発生は幕府よりの改易、取り潰しの理由となった。
sen.e: The feudal government might forfeit a domain or rank when an uprising started.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The bakufu would demote or expel an official if an uprising broke out.
The bakufu would demote or expel an official if an uprising broke out.

sen.j: そのため大名は年貢の軽減を図った（※）。
sen.e: Therefore, feudal lords tried to reduce land tax(*).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: It is for this reason that daimyo attempted to reduce land taxes*.
It is for this reason that daimyo attempted to reduce land taxes*.

sen.j: 江戸時代を通じて公対民の年貢率は一貫して下がる傾向があり（特に幕府直轄地において）逃散はそれほど深刻な問題とはならなくなっていったと考えられる。
sen.e: Since public versus private land tax tended to fall consistently through the Edo period, it is thought that chosan was no longer serious issue (especially in government-ruled area).
Since public versus private land tax tended to fall consistently throughout the Edo period (especially in government-ruled areas), it is thought that chosan was no longer serious issue.
Since public versus private land tax tended to fall consistently throughout the Edo period (especially in government-ruled areas), it is thought that chosan was no longer serious issue.

sen.j: それでも、百姓らは権利要求の手段として、逃散を行うこともあり、江戸などの都市部へ流入した。
sen.e: Nevertheless, peasants might choose chosan as a means of demanding the right, and they came to urban areas, such as Edo.
Nevertheless, there were cases of peasants using chosan as a means of demanding rights, and they flowed into to urban areas such as Edo.
Nevertheless, there were cases of peasants using chosan as a means of demanding rights, and they flowed into to urban areas such as Edo.

sen.j: その結果、都市部では貧民が多く存在するようになった。
sen.e: As a result, population of poor people had grown in urban areas.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: As a result, the population of poor people grew in urban areas.
As a result, the population of poor people grew in urban areas.

sen.j: それに伴う犯罪の増加など、現代まで続く都市問題が見られるようになった。
sen.e: Following this, urban problems, such as rising crime, which still continue to the present day.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: This led to urban problems, such as rising crime, which still continue to the present day.
This led to urban problems, such as rising crime, which still continue to the present day.

sen.j: （※）一部の藩（薩摩藩など）においては全江戸期を通じて農民に対する厳しい収奪が行われ、中農、富農が成立する条件は成立しなかったとされることもある。
sen.e: (*) It is said that in some domains (Satsuma Domain etc.), there were no conditions that medium-scale farmers nor wealthy farmers emerged because farmers were severely exploited through all the Edo period.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: * In some domains (such as the Satsuma Domain), the harsh exploitation of farmers throughout the entire Edo period meant that the conditions under which middle-class or wealthy farmers could become established never emerged.

* In some domains (such as the Satsuma Domain), the harsh exploitation of farmers throughout the entire Edo period meant that the conditions under which middle-class or wealthy farmers could become established never emerged.

sen.j: しかし度を越した収奪が行われれば没落する農民が現れ富の寡占が進んで富農が出現するはずである。
sen.e: However, if excessive exploitation had occurred, some farmers might ruin, concentration of wealth should progress, and wealthy farmers should have emerged.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: However, under extreme exploitation, some farmers would become ruined, which should lead to the concentration of wealth and the emergence of wealthy farmers.
However, under extreme exploitation, some farmers would become ruined, which should lead to the concentration of wealth and the emergence of wealthy farmers.

sen.j: そのため、中農、富農が成立しないということは逆に農民が自立可能な程度の年貢であったことになる。
sen.e: Therefore, land tax should not be heavy so that farmers could keep independent since medium-scale farmers nor wealthy farmers had not emerged.
Therefore the reason why middle-class or wealthy farmers could not become established was land taxes which were sufficiently heavy to prevent farmers from becoming independent.
Therefore the reason why middle-class or wealthy farmers could not become established was land taxes which were sufficiently heavy to prevent farmers from becoming independent.

sen.j: 派生した用語
sen.e: The derived terminology
Derived Terminology
Derived Terminology

sen.j: 現代の日本において、勤務医の辞職を逃散と呼ぶことがある。
sen.e: In present-day Japan, resignation of hospital-employed physicians may be called chosan.
In present-day Japan, the resignation of public practice physicians is sometimes called chosan.
sen.cmt: "hospital-employed physicians" > "public practice physicians"Added "the""may be" > "is sometimes called"
sen.e: In present-day Japan, the resignation of public practice physicians is sometimes called chosan.

sen.j: 72時間連続の当直明け勤務など、労働基準法に違反する長時間労働を強いられている病院の医師が、待遇が改善されずに絶望して辞職することを指す。
sen.e: It means that hospital-based physicians who had been forced the long working hours, such as 72 hours in a row after night shift, which violate Labor Standard Law, resign despairing of unimproved working conditions.

It refers to hospital doctors who, forced to work long hours which violate Labor Standards Law such as working continuous 72 hour shifts, despair at the lack of improvement in working conditions and resign.

It refers to hospital doctors who, forced to work long hours which violate Labor Standards Law such as working continuous 72 hour shifts, despair at the lack of improvement in working conditions and resign.

sen.j: 小泉政権がすすめてきた医療費削減政策の結果、日本の勤務医の労働環境は悪化の一途をたどってきた。
sen.e: Koizumi administration's medical expense reduction policy had farther worsened labor condition of hospital-employed physicians in Japan.
As a result of the Koizumi administration's medical expenditure reduction policy, working conditions for public practice physicians grew steadily worse.
As a result of the Koizumi administration's medical expenditure reduction policy, working conditions for public practice physicians grew steadily worse.

sen.j: こうした状況に疲弊しきった勤務医が、最後にとりうる抵抗手段として辞職を選ぶようになった。
sen.e: The exhausted physicians started to choose to resign in protest at the end.
Exhausted physicians eventually chose to resign out of protest.
Exhausted physicians eventually chose to resign out of protest.

sen.j: 辞職はしばしば連鎖的に発生し、地方か都市かを問わず、基幹病院の診療体制を崩壊させる深刻な影響を与えている。
sen.e: Such resignations often follow in a chain reaction and may cause a serious problem such as collapse of medical structure in key hospitals of both rural and urban areas.
There were often a chain reactions of resignations which had the serious effect of causing treatment systems of foundation hospitals in both rural and urban areas to collapse.
There were often a chain reactions of resignations which had the serious effect of causing treatment systems of foundation hospitals in both rural and urban areas to collapse.

sen.j: 医療崩壊を象徴する現象・行動として、2005年ころから2ちゃんねるの医者板で広まった用法である。
sen.e: Symbolizing the phenomenon and movement of medical care break down, the terminology has been spread on the physician's thread of 2 Channel (online bulletin board service) since around 2005.
Symbolizing the phenomenon and movement of medical care break down, the term spread on the physician's thread of 2 Channel (an online forum) from around 2005.
Symbolizing the phenomenon and movement of medical care break down, the term spread on the physician's thread of 2 Channel (an online forum) from around 2005.

sen.j: 医療崩壊を描いた小松秀樹の著書、「医療崩壊―『立ち去り型サボタージュ』とは何か」
sen.e: Hideki KOMATSU wrote about collapse of medical care system in "IRyohokai- 'Tachisarigata Sabotage' Tohananika" (Collapse of Medical Care: What is 'Walk-off Sabotage').
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Hideki KOMATSU wrote about the collapse of the medical care system in "Iryo Hokai: 'Tachisarigata Sabotage' to ha nani ka" (Collapse of Medical Care: What is 'Walk-off Sabotage').
sen.cmt: Added "the" (x2)"Iryohokai-" > Iryo Hokai:""Tohananika" > "to ha nani ka"
sen.e: Hideki KOMATSU wrote about the collapse of the medical care system in "Iryo Hokai: 'Tachisarigata Sabotage' to ha nani ka" (Collapse of Medical Care: What is 'Walk-off Sabotage').

sen.j: この本では、「逃散」に相当する現象は「立ち去り型サボタージュ」と呼びかえられている。
sen.e: In his book, the author calls the phenomenon "tachisarigata sabotage" in place of "chosan".
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: In his book, the author refers to the phenomenon of "chosan" as "tachisarigata sabotage ".
sen.cmt: Rewritten to better reflect source text
sen.e: In his book, the author refers to the phenomenon of 'chosan' as 'tachisarigata sabotage' (Walk-off Sabotage).
sen.cmt: クォーテーションを変えました。

sen.j: この本が出てからは口当たりのよい後者の名称で呼ばれることが多い
sen.e: After this book comes out, "tachisarigata sabotage" is preferably used because it sounds milder.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: After the book was released, the milder sounding term "tachisarigata sabotage" more became commonly used.
After the book was released, the latter term which sound milder became commonly used more.
